name: 'Ivory Hues'
description: "Should we stay here till we're ash and bone, till there's nothing left of us but sunsets and stones?"             The intricacy of the Taj speaks for the love that blossomed in the hearts of Shah Jahaan and his beloved. Like Midas touch, it was golden. The death of Mumtaaz in 1631 flushed in like cold December, aching the heart of the emperor. Hence, the 'Sang-E-Mar Mar' edifice, its flannel cure.
